articles.content:
Greetings to President of Madagascar 
   Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on June 22 sent a message of greetings to Marc Ravalomanana, president of Madagascar, on the occasion of the 46th independence day.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Madagascar would grow stronger in the interests of the peoples of the two countries, the message wholeheartedly wished the government and people of Madagascar success in their work for the political stability, national unity and economic development of the country.

Greetings to Slovenian FM
   Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to his Slovenian counterpart Dimitrij Rupel on the occasion of the national day of Slovenia.
 The message sincerely wished him new success in his work, expressing the conviction that the friendly and cooperative bonds between the two countries would favorably develop in the future, too.

articles.content:
Preparatory Committee for Function in DPRK Inaugurated
   Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for a visit to the native home in the secret camp in Mt. Paektu was inaugurated on June 10 by the Latin American and Caribbean Regional Committee to Support the Reunification of Korea.
 An appeal released by the preparatory committee referred to the fact that a function would take place in February 2007 in connection with the visit to the old home of Kim Jong Il in the secret camp in Mt. Paektu. It called on the organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people in Latin American countries including Ecuador to positively support it and send delegations made up of well-known figures to the DPRK.

articles.title: Members of Young Vanguard Meet to Vow to Take Revenge upon U.S. Man-Killers
articles.content:
Swiss Preparatory Committee's Appeal Favored
   Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Trotsky Serano, president of the Canar Provincial Institute for the Friendship and Solidarity with the DPRK of Ecuador who is international secretary of the Socialist Party-Ample Front of Ecuador, released a statement on June 10 in support of an appeal of the Swiss Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Day of the Sun and Feb. 16 for visiting the old home of Kim Jong Il in the secret camp in Mt. Paektu in February 2007.
 The statement fully supported the above-said appeal of the Swiss preparatory committee.    
 The Ecuadorian people would celebrate the birthday of Kim Jong Il as the most significant holiday and send their delegation to the international function, the statement said, adding that they would publish the short biographies of the three generals of Mt. Paektu and hold colorful functions for introducing the immortal exploits of the leader in Ecuador on the occasion of the February holiday.

DPRK Government Delegation Leaves for Cuba
   Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- A DPRK government delegation led by Jon Sung Hun, vice-premier of the Cabinet, left here today to visit Cuba.
 It was seen off at the airport by Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and Ruben Perez Valdes, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Labor Law Provides Genuine Working Life to People
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for Africa
   Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegation headed by Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, left here on Saturday to participate in the 7th meeting of the African Union, the assembly of the heads of state and government, to be held in Gambia.
 The delegation will visit various countries in Africa in the wake of the meeting.

articles.content:
Greetings to Mozambican President
   Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Armando Emilio Guebuza, president of Mozambique, on June 22 on the occasion of the 31st anniversary of its independence.
 Kim in the message sincerely wished the government and people of Mozambique greater success in their efforts for the national unity and development of the country and expressed the belief that the bilateral good ties of friendship and cooperation would continue to grow stronger in the future, too.
